# Advertisement for a Standing Offer for Power-Assisted Rescue Scoops

## Advertisement Number
 PW-__ML-068-29396

## Publication Date
 2024-09-20

## Closing Date and Time for Statements of Capabilities
 2024-10-07T14:00:00

## Description of the Purchase
The Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) intends to enter into a standing offer for the supply of power-assisted rescue scoops for the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) Search and Rescue (SAR) program. The purchase is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, and the Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement.

## Technical Requirements
The power-assisted rescue scoops must meet the following technical requirements:
- Recover incapacitated casualties in the water
- Carefully recover casualties from the water directly onto the responding vessel
- Operate from the vessel
- Be used as a scramble net
- Have a rescue reach of between 2m and 6m
- Have a length of device along the vessel of between 3m and 7m
- Have a depth of device of between 5m and 12m
- Have a maximum weight of 500 kg
- Be fabricated using materials suitable for use in both fresh and salt water environments
- Comply with the Det Norske Veritas - Type Examination Certificate (DNV-TEC) for a Man Over Board Retrieval System

## Criteria for Assessment of Statements of Capabilities
A qualified supplier must demonstrate in writing that their proposed rescue scoop meets or exceeds the technical requirements listed above. The statement of capabilities must clearly describe how the supplier meets the advertised requirements and be submitted to the contact person by the closing date.

## Selected Supplier
DSS Protection NS Inc. has been pre-identified as the preferred supplier for the power-assisted rescue scoops. Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the goods or services described in the advertisement may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the contact person by the closing date.
